intro: Primula bullata, commonly known as the white primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Primula bullata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
